author: cnbc.com
title: QAD reports 4Q loss
text:
SANTA BARBARA, Calif. (AP) _ QAD Inc. (QADA) on Wednesday reported a loss of $5.2 million in its fiscal fourth quarter.
The Santa Barbara, California-based company said it had a loss of 28 cents per share. Losses, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 20 cents per share.
The enterprise software developer posted revenue of $80.8 million in the period.
For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $9.1 million, or 49 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $305 million.
For the current quarter ending in May, QAD said it expects revenue in the range of $80 million.
The company expects full-year revenue in the range of $328 million to $332 million.
QAD shares have climbed 15 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $44.50, a climb of 66 percent in the last 12 months.
